group5

Class ClothingCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • group5.ClothingCollection

  • public class ClothingCollection
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is in charge of handling the collection of clothing the user will have access of in the program. The class provides methods to add, remove, and edit clothing in the collection. The class also calculates the total and average price, handles serialization, and a few other methods like isEmpty and contains that help with functions in ClothingView.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClothingCollection()
      creates the ArrayList to which holds our collection of clothing and reads in any existing clothing from our serialization.

      provides access to whether the clothing collection is empty or not.

      a second rendition of the remove clothing function that instead of using an index, uses an element of the ArrayList to find which clothing to remove.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClothingCollection

        public ClothingCollection()
        creates the ArrayList to which holds our collection of clothing and reads in any existing clothing from our serialization.

    • Method Detail

      • addClothing

        public void addClothing(Clothing clothing)
        adds a new article of clothing to the ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        clothing - the clothing object to which is added.

      • removeClothing

        public void removeClothing(int index)
        removes an article of clothing found at the index provided in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        index - the index in the ArrayList to which the clothing is removed from.

      • removeClothing

        public void removeClothing(Clothing clothing)
        a second rendition of the remove clothing function that instead of using an index, uses an element of the ArrayList to find which clothing to remove.
        Parameters:
        clothing - the element of the ArrayList to which is removed.

      • setClothing

        public void setClothing(int index,
                        Clothing clothing)
        changes the value of a specific article of clothing found at index, being replaced with the new clothing found in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the ArrayList that is having its clothing changed.
        clothing - the clothing that is replacing the past clothing.

      • getClothing

        public Clothing getClothing(int index)
        provides access to a piece of clothing in the ArrayList found at the index provided in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        index - the location of the clothing in the collection.
        Returns:
        the clothing found in the index.

      • size

        public int size()
        provides access to the size of the clothing ArrayList.
        Returns:
        the size of the clothing collection.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        provides access to whether the clothing collection is empty or not.
        Returns:
        false if the collection is not empty, true if it is.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String name)
        finds if the name of an article of clothing already exits in the clothing collection.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to which we are searching duplicates for.
        Returns:
        true if duplicates are found, false if not.

      • containsForEdit

        public boolean containsForEdit(int avoid,
                               java.lang.String name)
        a different rendition of contains that will avoid a certain index in the collection. This serves the bullet proofing of the edit button so that the program will not stop the user from editing their clothing when they decide to not change the name.
        Parameters:
        avoid - the index to avoid when searching for duplicates in the collection.
        name - the name to which we are searching duplicates of.
        Returns:
        true if duplicates are found, false if not.

      • getSortedArray

        public Clothing[] getSortedArray()
        a sorted snapshot of the collection as an array.
        Returns:
        the snapshot array of the collection.

      • totalPrice

        public java.lang.String totalPrice()
        finds the total price of all the clothing found in the collection.
        Returns:
        the total price of all the clothing.

      • avgPrice

        public java.lang.String avgPrice()
        finds the average price of all the clothing found in collection.
        Returns:
        the average price of all the clothing.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(int index)
        makes a string representation of a chosen article of clothing found at index. The method provides the name, size, fabric, and price of the chosen clothing.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the clothing we want to toString.
        Returns:
        a representation of the chosen clothing and its attributes.
